item.description:
A new trail system has been opened up for hiking after two years of work on the Whitaker property which we will explore! This moderate effort looping hike is on mostly forested land covering 5.1 miles and a 4 hour maximum time.

There is a gradual upward trend for the first 2.3 miles of the hike on the Jerry Stage Trail on the McCann property and that is where some effort will be expended. The later 2.8 miles on the Whitaker property will be new and exploratory for our group so I am unsure as to what to expect other than forest and terrain which is not too rough. A few stream crossings over small rough bridges of half logs and peaceful atmosphere prevail on this conservation land hike.

We'll meet at the dirt parking lot at just before Noon and start the hike shortly thereafter. We should be done by no later than 4 PM. We can head out to eat at a local establishment after the hike if there are people willing.

The McCann Family Farm is a hilly 84 acres of farmland and mixed forest. Located on it are two brooks and two vernal pools. It includes hiking trails and the Whit Davis Bird Sanctuary. Whitaker Woods is 266 acres of woodland. Both adjacent properties are managed and preserved by the Northern Connecticut Land Trust (NCLT).

Things to bring:

* Daypack - to carry water and extra clothing items
* Waterproofed hiking boots or snow boots
* Layers of clothing - so extra can be taken off as you heat up
* Warm hat
* Gloves
* 1 quart water

Parking is limited so carpooling is encouraged. Kids are welcome on the hike.

 

Approximate location/directions to MEET AT SOMERS TOWN HALL - We will all pile into at most 8 cars and move to the Wells Rd. parking lot. After the hike we take the 8 cars back to the Town Hall (parking lotbehind {a.k.a. Rte. 190} 600 Main St., Somers, CT):
http://mapq.st/U2nPY4

Approximate location/directions where shuttles will go to (parking lot near 80 Wells Rd., Somers, CT):
http://mapq.st/WXiI8x

Textual Location/Directions: The Whitaker Woods is on Wells Rd. just off of Route 190, east of the village of Somers. Parking lot is on the south side of Wells Rd. (about 1 mile east of Route 83). Wells road is narrow so drive with caution. Parking is in a dirt lot.

Trail map:
http://www.northernctlandtrust.org/LinkClick.aspx?fileticket=yNLlQFc_E8Y%3d&tabid=330

McCann Family Farm more information:
http://www.northernctlandtrust.org/Properties/SomersCTProperties/McCannFamilyFarm/tabid/330/Default.aspx

Whitaker Woods more information:
http://www.northernctlandtrust.org/Properties/SomersCTProperties/WhitakerWoods/tabid/345/Default.aspx

Northern Connecticut Land Trust (NCLT):
http://www.northernctlandtrust.org/

-----------------
Original directions no longer valid due to snow:

Approximate location/directions (parking lot around 650 Main St., Somers, CT):
http://mapq.st/WKUVZo

Textual Location/Directions: The McCann Family Farm is on Route 190, east of the village of Somers. Parking lot is on the south side of 190, about 0.7 miles east of Route 83. The entrance is a short dirt road with a very dark wooden sign marking the entrance so be alert. Parking is in a dirt lot a short drive off the highway.

 

=== Legal Stuff ===

By clicking on "Yes" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
item.how_to_find_us: Silver Ford Escape SUV, CT plates.

group.name: The Hartford Area Hiking™ Meetup Group

item.name: Winter Hike at McCann Family Farm & Whitaker Woods Nature Preserves in Somers CT
